Get a dataset template

Source: R/01_utils.R
get_banff_template.Rd

This function gets the empty dataset with variables that are mandatory in the process.

get_banff_template()

Value

A tibble representing the empty dataset.

Examples

{

  get_banff_template()

}
#> # A tibble: 0 × 51
#> # ℹ 51 variables: patient_id <lgl>, center <lgl>, biopsy_id <lgl>,
#> #   sc_date_bx <lgl>, date_tx <lgl>, type_bx <lgl>, adequacy <lgl>,
#> #   fixation_ff <lgl>, fixation_paraffin <lgl>, fixation_elec <lgl>,
#> #   fixation_rna <lgl>, microscopy <lgl>, c4d_if <lgl>, c4d_ihc <lgl>,
#> #   dsa <lgl>, hist_dsa <lgl>, i_score <lgl>, t_score <lgl>, v_score <lgl>,
#> #   g_score <lgl>, ptc_score <lgl>, ti_score <lgl>, cg_score <lgl>,
#> #   mm_score <lgl>, cv_score <lgl>, ci_score <lgl>, ct_score <lgl>, …
